critique: This executive order, issued by President Clinton, addresses the actions and policies of UNITA in Angola. It blocks the property of UNITA and its senior officials, restricts the import of Angolan diamonds not controlled by the Angolan government, and limits the sale of mining equipment and transportation services to certain areas of Angola. The order aims to enforce UN Security Council resolutions. It does not directly relate to typical left-right ideological debates within the US. It doesn't directly impact immigration. It expands executive power to enforce these restrictions. It involves federal control over foreign policy and trade. It prioritizes national security and foreign policy objectives. It involves economic intervention through trade restrictions. It does not directly address social inclusion within the US.
